article: The United States _ a large part of the North American continent. Its neighbors are Canada _ the north, and Mexico to the south. _ the United States is a big country, it's not the largest in the world, In 1964 its population was over 185,000,000, When this land first became a nation, after winning independence from England, it had thirteen states, _ of the states was represented on the American flag by a star All the states were in the eastern part of the continent. As the nation grew towards the west, new states were in the eastern part of the continent. As the nation grew towards the west, new states were added and new stars appeared on the flag. For a long time, there were 48 states. In 1959, however, two _ stars were added to the flag _ the new states _ Alaska and Hawaii. Sometime it is said that the Indians are the only real Americans. Most Americans, however, are descendants of people who came from all over the world to find a new life in a new land. Those who came first and _ greatest numbers to make their home _ the eastern coast of North America were mostly from England. It is _ that reason that the language of the United States is English and that its culture and customs are more like those of England than of any other country in the world.
